page.title: 04RIVER EHEN OF CLEATOR MOOR
page.content: As far as rivers go,the River Ehen which runs through Cleator Moor is not very long. It flows from Lake Ennerdale to the Irish Sea.It contains eels,brown trout,sea trout and salmon which swim up the beck to spawn. Fishing was not too good last year,as there was not enough water for the fish to swim up the beck, until late on in the season. Another hazard was the wild mink which roam the banks of the river. Poaching is also a serious problem. The water is very clear and runs very quickly.A lovely part of the beck is under Wath Brow Bridge where people stay and have picnics in the summer,dogs splash and paddle while children skim stones,and swim in the deep pools. By Barry Pilkington 1985.
